content.text:
# Duke of Buckingham series

The Duke of Buckingham series is a 1590s cycle of Old and New Testament paintings by Paolo Veronese and his workshop. They were acquired in Venice in 1595 by Charles III de Croÿ, then Duke of Aarschot, and moved to his castle at Beaumont. It was acquired early in the 17th century by George Villiers, 1st Duke of Buckingham, hence its title. Most of the series are in the Kunsthistorisches Museum in Vienna, though two are in the National Gallery in Prague and one in the National Gallery of Art in Washington.
File:Lot und seine Töchter fliehen aus Sodom-khm.jpg|Lot and his Family Flee Sodom, Kunsthistorisches Museum, Vienna
File:Paolo Veronese - Agar e Ismaele nel deserto (KHM).jpg|The Angel Appears to Hagar in the Desert, Kunsthistorisches Museum, Vienna
File:Esther vor Ahasver-khm.jpg|Esther and Ahasuerus, Kunsthistorisches Museum, Vienna
File:Veronese, Paolo - Rebecca at the Well - c. 1580.jpg|Rebecca at the Well,  National Gallery of Art, Washington
File:Paolo Veronese - Susanna and the Elders - WGA24975.jpg|Susanna and the Elders, Kunsthistorisches Museum, Vienna
File:Paolo Veronese - Cristo e la Samaritana (KHM).jpg|The Samaritan Woman, Kunsthistorisches Museum, Vienna
File:Christus und die Ehebrecherin-khm.jpg|The Woman Taken in Adultery, Kunsthistorisches Museum, Vienna
File:Christus und der Hauptmann von Kafarnaum-khm.jpg|Christ and the Centurion, Kunsthistorisches Museum, Vienna
File:Paolo Veronese - Christ Washing the Feet of the Disciples - WGA24846.jpg|''Christ Washing the Disciples' Feet'', National Gallery, Prague
